availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Collins D. Bradley (Trigg County, KY, attorney. Com atty pro tem for Wadlington case)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, attorney and commonwealth's attorney pro tem. Virginia native. Married to Virginia Waddill Bradley in Trigg County, Kentucky, on December 25, 1832. Married to Mary Jenkins Bradley in Trigg County on May 21, 1850. Father of William G. Bradley, Daniel H. Bradley, and Anna Bradley. Stepfather of Frances A. Jenkins and Margaret A. Jenkins. Studied law in Trigg County in 1827. Attorney in Trigg County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in 1850 in Trigg County. Attorney in Cadiz in 1860. Commonwealth's attorney pro tempore in Caldwell County in June 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Cadiz in 1860.
